param.label: Distance
param.help: Distance between k-mer pairs. Multiple distances are separated by comma, e.g. 500,1000,2000,3000

param.label: Step
param.help: Step of sliding window when extracting k-mer pairs from long reads. Multiple steps are separated by comma, e.g. 10,5

param.label: Maximum link ratio
param.help: Maximum link ratio between two best contig pairs. Higher values lead to least accurate scaffolding

param.label: Number of links
param.help: Minimum number of links (k-mer pairs) to compute scaffold

param.label: Offset
param.help: Offset position for extracting k-mer pairs

param.label: Bloom filter false positive rate
param.help: Increase to prevent memory allocation errors

param.label: Minimum contig length
param.help: Minimum contig length to consider for scaffolding

tool.help:
.. figure:: https://github.com/warrenlr/links/raw/master/links-logo.png :alt: links-logo :width: 200px
`LINKS <https://github.com/bcgsc/LINKS>`__ is a genomics application for scaffolding genome assemblies with long reads, such as those produced by Oxford Nanopore Technologies Ltd. It can be used to scaffold high-quality draft genome assemblies with any long sequences (eg. ONT reads, PacBio reads, other draft genomes, etc).
**Input**:
**LINKS does not use quality information in the Reads, so it is recommended to filter the long reads first**.
Provide a ``fasta`` or ``fasta.gz`` dataset containing the Contigs, and a ``fastq``, ``fastq.gz``, ``fasta`` or ``fasta.gz`` dataset of Reads to be used for scaffolding.
**Use cases**:
- *Use long reads to scaffold a draft assembly* by providing the draft assembly to the Contigs parameter and the long reads to the Reads parameter. - *Use a reference assembly to scaffold a draft assembly* by providing the reference assembly to the Reads parameter. For example, you could use a speciesâ€™s reference genome to scaffold a genome that was assembled for another individual.
**How it works**:
LINKS uses *k*-mer pairs from the Reads to identify candidate pairs of Contigs, then uses the number of spanning *k*-mer pairs and the mean distance between them to build scaffolds.
You can control the distance between *k*-mer pairs, the length of the *k*-mers and the minimum number of *k*-mer pairs between contigs. See the `LINKS readme on GitHub <https://github.com/bcgsc/LINKS#how-it-works>`__ for information on setting advanced parameters.
